law.catch_line: This section applies to each employee of a local board....

section.section: This section applies to each employee of a local board.

This section does not apply to:
local board counsel; or
an election judge.

text.section: This section does not alter in any manner the method by which the salary of an employee of a local board is funded by the county in which the employee is employed.

section.section:
Except as provided in subsection (f) of this section, if the employees of a local board are covered by its county merit system:
the employees shall be classified employees under the county merit system; and
the employees may be appointed and removed subject to the personnel regulations of the county in which the local board is located.

If the employees of a local board are not covered by its county merit system:
the employees shall be in the skilled service or professional service of the State Personnel Management System;
appointment and removal of the employees shall be in accordance with the provisions of the State Personnel and Pensions Article that govern skilled service or professional service employees; and
notwithstanding § 4-201 of the State Personnel and Pensions Article, upon recommendation of the State Administrator, the State Board shall determine the fixed rate of compensation of the employees.

text.section: Each classified employee shall be a registered voter of the State.
An employee of a local board is subject to the restrictions and requirements of § 2-301 of this title.
The election director in Prince George's County shall be in the exempt service under the Prince George's County Personnel System.
